responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Trial license generation uses user-controlled URLs
    analysis: |
      The `TrialLicenseGenerator` component uses user-controlled URLs to generate trial licenses. 
      An attacker can control the `storeTrialURL` and `storeUpdateURL` properties by modifying the `LicensingStoreClass` object
      on the `Licenses.Code.LicensingConfig` page. Both properties are used to construct URLs that are then passed to `XWiki.getURLContent()`,
      which performs an HTTP request to retrieve the trial license. This could allow for SSRF or other injection vulnerabilities.
    cwe: CWE-918
    function_names:
      - getTrialURL
      - getLicensesUpdateURL
    filenames:
      - application-licensing-licensor/application-licensing-licensor-api/src/main/java/com/xwiki/licensing/internal/TrialLicenseGenerator.java
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Trial license generation uses user-controlled URLs
leads.analysis:
The TrialLicenseGenerator component uses user-controlled URLs to generate trial licenses. 
An attacker can control the storeTrialURL and storeUpdateURL properties by modifying the LicensingStoreClass object
on the Licenses.Code.LicensingConfig page. Both properties are used to construct URLs that are then passed to XWiki.getURLContent(),
which performs an HTTP request to retrieve the trial license. This could allow for SSRF or other injection vulnerabilities.
